M8.039,15.576c-1.563-0.187-2.909-0.781-3.91-1.688c1.939-1.406,2.377-2.222,2.377-3.785V3.754l0.062-0.062   c0.626,0.062,0.971,0.094,1.471,0.125V15.576z M26.805,8.915l-2.533,2.033V6.569l0.094-0.094L26.805,8.915z M28.775,13.952   l-0.188-0.189c-1.001,1.065-1.438,1.346-2.189,1.346c-0.562,0-1.22-0.342-2.126-1.188v-2.564l4.503-3.439L25.71,4.88   c-1.345,1.063-1.563,1.251-2.533,2.002c-0.532,0.405-0.845,0.594-1.189,0.75c0.062,0.375,0.125,0.907,0.125,1.282v5.726   c-0.531,0.498-1.032,0.719-1.407,0.719c-0.501,0-0.876-0.312-0.876-0.844V6.851c-0.312-0.969-0.906-1.595-2.064-2.001l-2.847,2.314   v-5.38c0-0.781,0.438-1.5,0.844-1.688V0c-1.157,0-1.97,0.752-2.314,1.628l-0.5-1.033l-0.188,0.032V14.39   c-1.125,0.594-2.345,1.25-3.691,1.25c-0.249,0-0.469,0-0.719-0.029V3.849c0.595,0.062,0.97,0.093,1.314,0.093   c0.531,0,0.876-0.093,1.126-0.219l1.533-3.128l-0.25-0.062c-0.594,1.188-0.906,1.375-2.189,1.375c-0.594,0-1.908-0.155-3.222-0.312   C5.411,1.44,4.128,1.284,3.473,1.284c-1.939,0-3.066,1.345-3.066,2.722c0,0.562,0.187,1.126,0.564,1.626l0.217-0.156   c-0.249-0.313-0.405-0.72-0.405-1.064c0-0.562,0.438-1.062,1.626-1.062c0.47,0,2.127,0.157,3.69,0.28   C4.316,4.505,2.847,5.443,1.126,6.757C0.375,7.758,0,9.041,0,10.354c0,3.377,2.565,7.035,8.227,7.035   c1.657-0.937,4.097-2.345,4.097-2.345l2.252,2.033l1.563-1.533l-1.22-1.282V7.727c0.532-0.719,1.126-1.032,1.596-1.032   c0.531,0,1.031,0.376,1.157,1.064v7.852c0.187,0.656,0.968,1.279,1.751,1.5l2.784-2.096l3.222,2.221L28.775,13.952z\"></path>\n\n\t<!-- fallback .png -->\n\t<image src=\"/bg-images/png/bg-logo--full.png\" xlink:href=\"\"/>\n</svg>\n</a>\n\t<ul class=\"social-tools\">\n\t\t<li class=\"social-tools__list-item\">\n\t\t\t\t<a href=\"#comments\" onclick=\"var s=s_gi('nytbostonglobecom'); s.linkTrackVars='eVar15,channel,prop1,prop4'; s.linkTrackEvents='none'; s.tl(this,'o', 'Article_Comments_Header');\">\n\t\t\t\t\t<svg version=\"1.1\" id=\"comment-icon\" xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/2000/svg\" xmlns:xlink=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink\" x=\"0px\" y=\"0px\" width=\"15px\" height=\"17.063px\" viewBox=\"0 0 15 17.063\" enable-background=\"new 0 0 15 15,12.461 7.588,12.461 \"/>\n\n\t<!-- fallback .png -->\n\t<image src=\"/bg-images/png/comment.png\" xlink:href=\"\"/>\n</svg>\n</a>\n\t\t\t</li>\n\t\t<li class=\"social-tools__list-item\">\n\t\t\t<a href=\"//twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=After the rape and murder of his wife, a father carries on&url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.bostonglobe.com%2Fmetro%2F2017%2F03%2F28%2Fafter-murder-his-wife-father-carries%2FIFSEFoLRxSosNnZoE1hWlJ%2Fstory.html%3Fs_camp%3Dbostonglobe%3Asocial%3Asharetools%3Atwitter\" onclick=\"var s=s_gi('nytbostonglobecom'); s.linkTrackVars='eVar15,channel,prop1,prop4'; s.linkTrackEvents='none'; s.tl(this,'o', 'BG Article Share Tools - Twitter');\" target=\"_blank\">\n\t\t\t\t<svg version=\"1.1\" id=\"twitter-icon\" xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/2000/svg\" xmlns:xlink=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink\" x=\"0px\" y=\"0px\" width=\"20.932px\" height=\"17px\" viewBox=\"0 0 20.932 17\" enable-background=\"new 0 0 20.932 17\" xml:space=\"preserve\" aria-labelledby=\"twitter-title\">\n\t<title id=\"twitter-title\">Tweet this</title>\n\t<path id=\"path-1\" d=\"M20.905,2.047c-0.588,0.874-1.306,1.612-2.144,2.215c0.017,0.125,0.022,0.309,0.022,0.547\n\t    c0,1.159-0.165,2.31-0.499,3.453c-0.334,1.144-0.842,2.248-1.523,3.31c-0.684,1.063-1.5,1.991-2.449,2.783\n\t    c-0.956,0.795-2.098,1.438-3.432,1.932c-1.333,0.49-2.762,0.729-4.288,0.712c-2.396,0-4.594-0.644-6.593-1.929\n\t    c0.317,0.032,0.665,0.046,1.047,0.046c2,0,3.781-0.609,5.335-1.832c-0.938-0.015-1.77-0.302-2.501-0.858\n\t    c-0.734-0.553-1.241-1.259-1.528-2.117c0.287,0.046,0.557,0.069,0.812,0.069c0.382,0,0.755-0.045,1.119-0.143\n\t    C3.3,10.031,2.473,9.539,1.805,8.761C1.143,7.986,0.817,7.074,0.833,6.025V5.979c0.604,0.333,1.245,0.516,1.926,0.547\n\t    C2.173,6.127,1.705,5.62,1.356,5.002c-0.35-0.62-0.523-1.302-0.523-2.05c0-0.779,0.199-1.5,0.597-2.169\n\t    c1.077,1.321,2.379,2.376,3.903,3.172c1.524,0.79,3.169,1.236,4.928,1.33c-0.065-0.333-0.095-0.658-0.095-0.976\n\t    c0-1.192,0.421-2.207,1.263-3.047C12.27,0.421,13.284,0,14.478,0c1.236,0,2.284,0.453,3.142,1.357c0.967-0.19,1.871-0.54,2.713-1.05\n\t    c-0.331,1.018-0.96,1.804-1.879,2.361c0.824-0.097,1.65-0.32,2.479-0.669L20.905,2.047L20.905,2.047z\"/>\n\n\t<!-- fallback .png -->\n\t<image src=\"/bg-images/png/twitter.png\" xlink:href=\"\"/>\n</svg>\n</a>\n\t\t</li>\n\t\t<li class=\"social-tools__list-item\">\n\t\t\t<a href=\"http://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.bostonglobe.com%2Fmetro%2F2017%2F03%2F28%2Fafter-murder-his-wife-father-carries%2FIFSEFoLRxSosNnZoE1hWlJ%2Fstory.html%3Fs_camp%3Dbostonglobe%3Asocial%3Asharetools%3Afacebook&t=After the rape and murder of his wife, a father carries on\" onclick=\"var s=s_gi('nytbostonglobecom'); s.linkTrackVars='eVar15,channel,prop1,prop4'; s.linkTrackEvents='none'; s.tl(this,'o', 'BG Article Share Tools - Facebook');\" target=\"_blank\">\n\t\t\t\t<svg version=\"1.1\" id=\"facebook-icon\" xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/2000/svg\" xmlns:xlink=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink\" x=\"0px\" y=\"0px\" width=\"7.938px\" \t\theight=\"17px\" viewBox=\"0 0 7.938 17\" enable-background=\"new 0 0 7.938 17\" xml:space=\"preserve\" aria-labelledby=\"facebook-title\">\n\t<title id=\"facebook-title\">Facebook</title>\n\t<path id=\"path-1\" d=\"M5.291,5.567h2.646L7.623,8.492H5.274V17H1.753V8.492H0V5.567h1.755V3.811c0-1.259,0.297-2.21,0.89-2.847\n    C3.236,0.321,4.212,0,5.567,0h2.349v2.922H6.457c-0.272,0-0.489,0.025-0.648,0.074c-0.159,0.049-0.276,0.128-0.351,0.24\n    c-0.074,0.112-0.124,0.23-0.149,0.351C5.285,3.712,5.274,3.882,5.274,4.107v1.46H5.291L5.291,5.567z\"/>\n\n\t<!-- fallback .png -->\n\t<image src=\"/bg-images/png/facebook.png\" xlink:href=\"\"/>\n</svg>\n</a>\n\t\t</li>\n\t</ul>\n</header>\n<!-- Page header ends -->\n\n<main class=\"big-article\" data-uuid=\"3b8335b8-141a-11e7-8513-19a688a565f6\">\n\t<article>\n\n\t\t<!-- Article lead media. -->\n\t\t<figure class=\"lead-media\">\n\t<img src=\"//c.o0bg.com/rf/image_835w/Boston/2011-2020/2017/03/29/BostonGlobe.com/Metro/Images/thiago-9026.jpg\" alt=\"Richard Nunez dressed his son, Thiago, at their Stone-ham apartment. The boy suffers from a genetic disorder.\" class=\"lead-media__media\" srcset=\"//c.o0bg.com/rf/image_1920w/Boston/2011-2020/2017/03/29/BostonGlobe.com/Metro/Images/thiago-9026.jpg 1024w, //c.o0bg.com/rf/image_1200w/Boston/2011-2020/2017/03/29/BostonGlobe.com/Metro/Images/thiago-9026.jpg 640w, //c.o0bg.com/rf/image_835w/Boston/2011-2020/2017/03/29/BostonGlobe.com/Metro/Images/thiago-9026.jpg 320w\" sizes=\"100vw\">\n\t<figcaption class=\"lead-media__info\">\n\t\t<div class=\"lead-media__caption\">Richard Nunez dressed his son, Thiago, at their Stoneham apartment. The boy suffers from a genetic disorder.</div>\n\t\t\t<div class=\"lead-media__credit\">John Tlumacki/Globe staff</div>\n\t\t</figcaption>\n</figure>\n<!-- Article headline/byline/timestamp. -->\n\t\t<div class=\"article-header\">\n<h1 class=\"article-header__headline\">After the rape and murder of his wife, a father carries on</h1>\n\t<div class=\"article-header__byline\">\n\t\t<!---->By <a class=\"article-header__byline-link\" title=\"More Stories by Maria Cramer\" href=\"/staff/cramer\" rel=\"author\"><span itemprop=\"name\">Maria Cramer</span></a><span class=\"article-header__byline-role\">, Globe Staff</span>\n\t\t<span class=\"article-header__pubdate\">March 29, 2017</span>\n\t</div>\n</div>\n<!-- Article content. -->\n\t\t<div class=\"article-content\">\n\n\t<p>Richard Nunez is up almost every morning at 4 to feed his 6-year-old son and change his diaper.</p><p id=\"U831919418146KqD\" style=\" letter-spacing: -30; ;\">Thiago Nunez was born with severe disabilities that left him unable to walk on his own and functioning at the level of an infant. He relies almost entirely on his father, a 51-year-old former gym instructor who was left to care for Thiago and two other children after his wife was raped and murdered by a former neighbor in Mattapan in 2011. </p><p>&ldquo;I&rsquo;m alone with Thiago and it is hard,&rdquo; Nunez said. &ldquo;I have three children to take care of and they&rsquo;re all destroyed emotionally.&rdquo;</p><p>Last week, Nunez settled a lawsuit with the Dolben Company in Woburn, the firm that managed the complex on Fairlawn Avenue where Nunez&rsquo;s wife, Rosanna Mirielle Camilo, was killed. The confidential agreement was reached on the second day of jury deliberations following a two-week trial. The terms were not disclosed, but the family had asked the jury to award them over $22 million.</p><div class=\"inline-ad inline-ad-1\">\n\t<div class=\"inline-ad__notification\">\n\t\t<span class=\"inlne-ad__notification-text\">\n\t\t\tAdvertisement\n\t\t</span>\n\t</div>\n\t<!-- adLayerPath: /Boston/Production/BostonGlobe.com/WebPages/Homepage/homepage.ad-layer.story-asset.dwp -->\n\t<div class=\"ad aside\" id=\"ad_supelead1\"></div>  </div>\n\n\n<p>A lawyer for Dolben, who argued in court that the company could not have prevented the killing, declined to comment on the settlement. </p><p>\n<b class=\"b\"></b>Whatever financial reward the settlement produces, it cannot erase the years of hardship, past and future, that are the legacy of the violence of one afternoon six years ago. Crime victims often fall quickly from the public eye, left to deal alone with the emotional aftermath.</p><p> This was especially true of Richard Nunez.</p><div class=\"inline-ad inline-ad-2\">\n\t<div class=\"inline-ad__notification\">\n\t\t<span class=\"inlne-ad__notification-text\">\n\t\t\tAdvertisement\n\t\t</span>\n\t</div>\n\t<!-- adLayerPath: /Boston/Production/BostonGlobe.com/WebPages/Homepage/homepage.ad-layer.story-asset.dwp -->\n\t<div class=\"ad aside\" id=\"ad_supelead2\"></div>  </div>\n<p>The trial over the suit in Suffolk Superior Court earlier this month revealed the struggles the family has endured since the murder of Camilo, who was 34 when Eldrick Broom came into her basement apartment, raped her, then strangled her while Thiago lay in a crib in the next room. Camilo&rsquo;s daughter found her half-naked and bound body when she came home from school. </p><p></p><figure class=\"inline-media inline-media--wide inline-media--bleed\">\n<img sizes=\"100vw\" class=\"inline-media__image\" alt=\"A photograph of Richard Nunez's wife, Rosanna, adorned an end table in the living room of Nunez's apartment.\" srcset=\"//c.o0bg.com/rf/image_1200w/Boston/2011-2020/2017/03/18/BostonGlobe.com/Metro/Images/tlumacki_ThiagoNunez_metro004.jpg 1200w, //c.o0bg.com/rf/image_835w/Boston/2011-2020/2017/03/18/BostonGlobe.com/Metro/Images/tlumacki_ThiagoNunez_metro004.jpg 835w, //c.o0bg.com/rf/image_460w/Boston/2011-2020/2017/03/18/BostonGlobe.com/Metro/Images/tlumacki_ThiagoNunez_metro004.jpg 460w\" src=\"//c.o0bg.com/rf/image_460w/Boston/2011-2020/2017/03/18/BostonGlobe.com/Metro/Images/tlumacki_ThiagoNunez_metro004.jpg\"><figcaption class=\"inline-media__info\">\n<div class=\"inline-media__caption\">A photograph of Richard Nunez's wife, Rosanna, adorned an end table in the living room of Nunez's apartment.</div>\n<div class=\"inline-media__credit\">John Tlumacki/Globe staff</div>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p></p><p>Camilo and Nunez had met in 1994 in their native Dominican Republic and already had two children when she became pregnant with Thiago in 2009. Doctors warned there could be complications. An energetic, affectionate woman with a deep Catholic faith, Camilo left behind a comfortable job arranging schedules for the country&rsquo;s president to have her baby in New Jersey, where she had family and access to better medical care.</p><p>Nunez stayed behind to care for the other children &mdash; a girl who is now 21, and a boy, who is now 16. </p><p>Thiago&rsquo;s condition was even worse than the couple had feared: He was born with a rare genetic abnormality so severe it kills most who have it. \n</p><div class=\"inline-newsletter\" data-exact-target-ID=\"20233035\" data-mailing-list-name=\"Fast Forward\" data-is-amp=\"\" data-section=\"\">\n  <div class=\"inline-newsletter__network-error\"></div>\n  <div class=\"inline-newsletter__copy\">\n    <div class=\"inline-newsletter__title\">\n      Get <span class=\"inline-newsletter__bold\">Fast Forward</span> in your inbox:\n    </div>\n    <div class=\"inline-newsletter__description\">\n        Forget yesterday's news. Get what you need today in this early-morning email.</div>\n    </div>\n  <form class=\"inline-newsletter__content\" method=\"post\">\n    <div class=\"inline-newsletter__error-text\"></div>\n    <input placeholder=\"Enter email address\" type=\"text\" id=\"inline-newsletter-email-input\" class=\"inline-newsletter__input\">\n    \n    <label class=\"inline-newsletter__input-label\" for=\"inline-newsletter-email-input\">Enter email address:</label>\n\t<div class=\"inline-newsletter__button-container\">\n      <button class=\"inline-newsletter__button\">\n        <span class=\"inline-newsletter__button-text\">Sign Up</span>\n      </button>\n      <div class=\"inline-newsletter__spinner\"></div>\n    </div>\n  </form>\n  <div class=\"inline-newsletter__thanks\">\n    Thank you for signing up! \n    <a href=\"/newsletters?p1=Article_inline-newsletterWidget_ThankYou_Link\" class=\"inline-newsletter__link\">Sign up for more newsletters here</a>\n    </div>\n</div>\n\n<p>Camilo moved to Boston to be near Children&rsquo;s Hospital, and her daughter, then 16, moved to the city to help. </p><p>Camilo was placed in the Mattapan apartment in July 2011 by Action for Boston Community Development, a nonprofit that helps low-income families and families with special needs find housing.</p><p>The 347-unit complex, which is off Cummins Highway, had no surveillance cameras or guards despite a long history of problems, including the 2008 shooting of an infant being held by her father.</p><p>But Camilo could not afford to live anywhere else. Broom was among the more cordial residents, according to testimony at the trial. He lived across the hall with his pregnant girlfriend and had once helped Camilo carry groceries and Thiago&rsquo;s heavy stroller.</p><div class=\"inline-ad inline-ad-3\">\n\t<div class=\"inline-ad__notification\">\n\t\t<span class=\"inlne-ad__notification-text\">\n\t\t\tAdvertisement\n\t\t</span>\n\t</div>\n\t<!-- adLayerPath: /Boston/Production/BostonGlobe.com/WebPages/Homepage/homepage.ad-layer.story-asset.dwp -->\n\t<div class=\"ad aside\" id=\"ad_supelead3\"></div>  </div>\n<p>Camilo had no idea that in August 2011 Broom had attacked his girlfriend, grabbing her by the throat and cursing at her in front of her children, according to arrest reports. But the girlfriend later recanted, saying Broom only pushed her. She did not want to press charges or kick Broom out of the home, and Dolben lawyers argued during the trial that managers could do little under those circumstances. </p><p></p><figure class=\"inline-media inline-media--wide inline-media--bleed\">\n<img sizes=\"100vw\" class=\"inline-media__image\" alt=\"Closing arguments took place in Suffolk Superior Court earlier this month in the case of the Camilo family vs. Fairlawn Avenue Apartments. \" srcset=\"//c.o0bg.com/rf/image_1200w/Boston/2011-2020/2017/03/17/BostonGlobe.com/Metro/Images/tlumacki_camilotrial_metro030.jpg 1200w, //c.o0bg.com/rf/image_835w/Boston/2011-2020/2017/03/17/BostonGlobe.com/Metro/Images/tlumacki_camilotrial_metro030.jpg 835w, //c.o0bg.com/rf/image_460w/Boston/2011-2020/2017/03/17/BostonGlobe.com/Metro/Images/tlumacki_camilotrial_metro030.jpg 460w\" src=\"//c.o0bg.com/rf/image_460w/Boston/2011-2020/2017/03/17/BostonGlobe.com/Metro/Images/tlumacki_camilotrial_metro030.jpg\"><figcaption class=\"inline-media__info\">\n<div class=\"inline-media__caption\">Closing arguments took place in Suffolk Superior Court earlier this month in the case of the Camilo family vs. Fairlawn Avenue Apartments. </div>\n<div class=\"inline-media__credit\">John Tlumacki/Globe staff</div>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p></p><p>But Albert Farrah, the family&rsquo;s lawyer, told jurors that managers had an obligation to keep him from the property and warn other residents about his arrest. </p><p>Instead, Dolben managers moved him to another apartment in the complex.</p><p>Convicted of killing Camilo in 2013, Broom was sentenced to life in prison. </p><p> Nunez, who had come to Massachusetts after the murder, eventually moved into a small apartment in Stoneham with Thiago and his two other children. Too overwhelmed by grief and the needs of his children to search for a job, Nunez relied on the local food pantry and second-hand stores for clothes. With the civil case behind him, Nunez said he is hopeful he can pay for his children&rsquo;s college education and Thiago&rsquo;s medical needs. </p><p></p><figure class=\"inline-media inline-media--wide inline-media--bleed\">\n<img sizes=\"100vw\" class=\"inline-media__image\" alt=\"Thiago Nunez, 6, tried to kiss his father from inside a special netted bed where he got up from a short rest while his father was doing laundry. \" srcset=\"//c.o0bg.com/rf/image_1200w/Boston/2011-2020/2017/03/18/BostonGlobe.com/Metro/Images/tlumacki_ThiagoNunez_metro018.jpg 1200w, //c.o0bg.com/rf/image_835w/Boston/2011-2020/2017/03/18/BostonGlobe.com/Metro/Images/tlumacki_ThiagoNunez_metro018.jpg 835w, //c.o0bg.com/rf/image_460w/Boston/2011-2020/2017/03/18/BostonGlobe.com/Metro/Images/tlumacki_ThiagoNunez_metro018.jpg 460w\" src=\"//c.o0bg.com/rf/image_460w/Boston/2011-2020/2017/03/18/BostonGlobe.com/Metro/Images/tlumacki_ThiagoNunez_metro018.jpg\"><figcaption class=\"inline-media__info\">\n<div class=\"inline-media__caption\">Thiago Nunez, 6, tried to kiss his father from inside a special netted bed where he got up from a short rest while his father was doing laundry. </div>\n<div class=\"inline-media__credit\">John Tlumacki/Globe staff</div>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p></p><p>Thiago, who could live to be 40 to 45 years old, will need round the clock care for the rest of his life, according to his doctor, Ronald Samuels of Children&rsquo;s Hospital, who testified during the trial. &ldquo;I think it&rsquo;s very likely he will not develop much beyond the range of a toddler,&rdquo; Samuels said. </p><p>The family is now planning to leave Massachusetts for a fresh start and Nunez said he is anxious to start looking for work. The family is fiercely protective of Thiago, a joyful boy who craves affection. During the day he goes to the Campus School at Boston College for children with disabilities. Each day he is dropped off from school by a van, but before the driver even unbuckles him, Nunez rushes in to grab the boy and wrap him in a bear hug, singing his name. At his wife&rsquo;s funeral, Nunez swore he would always be there for Thiago.</p><p>&ldquo;When I was putting my wife six feet down I made a promise to her,&rdquo; he said. &ldquo;She was crazy about that boy.&rdquo;</p><p></p><div class=\"article-tagline\">\n<p>Maria Cramer can be reached at <a class=\"a\" href=\"mailto:mcramer@globe.com\">mcramer@globe.com</a> \n\n</p>\n</div><footer class=\"article-footer\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n<script>var uuid = '3b8335b8-141a-11e7-8513-19a688a565f6';</script>\n<div id=\"comments\">\n\t<div id=\"comments-content\" class=\"ugc-comments comments\">\n\t\t<div class=\"loading-message\" id=\"loading-comments\">\n\t\t\tLoading comments...\n\t\t\t </div>\n\t</div>\n</div>\n<div id=\"newcomments\"></div>\n</footer>\n</div>\n</article>\n\n\t<!-- Article recirc. -->\n\t<div class=\"article-recirc\">\n\t\t<div class=\"article-recirc__header\">\n\t\t\t<h2 class=\"article-recirc__heading\">Related</h2>\n\t\t</div>\n\t\t<ul class=\"article-recirc__list\">\n\t    <!-- I've been called! -->\n<li class=\"article-recirc__item\">\n\t\t\t\t\t<a href=\"/2017/03/28/fairlawn-xml-gallery/Cue7TOjeY8GLqGNmroSDlJ/story.html?p1=Article_Related_BigArticle\">\n\t\t        <img class=\"article-recirc__image\" src=\"//c.o0bg.com/rf/image_375x250/Boston/2011-2020/2017/03/18/BostonGlobe.com/Metro/Images/tlumacki_ThiagoNunez_metro005.jpg\" alt=\"\"/>\n\t\t        <h3 class=\"article-recirc__headline\">Photos: A father\u2019s devotion</h3>\n\t\t\t\t\t</a>\n\t\t\t\t</li>\n\t\n\t\t\t<!-- I've been called! Fetching your information.... ');\n    FB.api('/me', function(response) {\n      // console.log('Successful login for: ' + response.name);\n\n      var fbObject = {};\n      fbObject.email = response.email;\n      fbObject.firstName = response.first_name;\n      fbObject.lastName = response.last_name;\n\n\t\t\tif(response.gender === undefined){\n\t\t\t\t// console.log('Gender is custom or undefined');\n\t\t\t}else{\n      fbObject.gender = ( response.gender == \"male\" ) ? 'M' : 'F';\n\t\t\t}\n      // console.log(response);\n      // console.log(fbObject);\n\t  bglobe.social.sendEmail(fbObject);\n    });\n  }\n  function statusChangeCallback(response) {\n    // console.log('statusChangeCallback');\n    // console.log(response);\n    if (response.status === 'connected') {\n      // console.log('Successful login');\n    } else if (response.status === 'not_authorized') {\n      //  console.log('The person is logged into Facebook, but not your app');\n    } else {\n      //  console.log('The person is not logged into Facebook');\n    }\n  }\n\n  function checkLoginState() {\n    FB.getLoginStatus(function(response) {\n      statusChangeCallback(response);\n    });\n  }\n  function fblogin(){\n\t  FB.login(function(response){\n\t\t  if(response.authResponse){\n\t\t\t  // console.log('connected');\n\t\t\t  testAPI();\n\t\t  }else{\n\t\t  // console.log('User response not authorized');\n\t\t  }\n\t  },{scope:\"public_profile,email\"});\n  }\n  function getScriptCached(url, ajaxOpts){\n\t  ajaxOpts = $.extend( ajaxOpts || {} , {dataType: \"script\", cache: true, url: url});\n\t  return jQuery.ajax( ajaxOpts );\n  }\n</script>\n\n\n<div style=\"display:none;\">\n<!--  infinite meter AGAIN !@)$&!()!!! -->\n\n<div class=\"bg-modal__bottom-modal\" paywall-square-meter social-login email-login\">\n  <div class=\"inner\">\n      <h3 class=\"modal-title\">Wake up with<br> today&rsquo;s top stories</h3>\n    <span class=\"desktop-text\">Get <span class=\"bld\">Today\u2019s Headlines</span> every morning and breaking news as it unfolds.</span>\n\t<div class=\"social-row\"><button id=\"fb-button\" class=\"bg-button--fb\" Modal';\r\n\t    }\r\n\t  }\r\n\tglobe.extend(globe.analytics.omniture, {\r\n\t  'pageType' : '',\r\n\t  'pageName' : sPageName,\r\n\t  'channel'  : sChannel,\r\n\t  'prop1'    : sProp1,\r\n\t src=\"http://newyorktimes.112.2o7.net/b/ss/nytbostonglobecom/1/H.23.3--NS/0?pageName=News%20%7C%20BGC%20Homepage&amp;ch=News&amp;c1=News%20%7C%20BGC%20Homepage&amp;c6=BGC%20Homepage&amp;c41=BostonGlobe.com&amp;v41=BostonGlobe.com\" src=\"/js/dist/bglobesubs.js,dist/globe-analytics.js,dist/globe-adcatalog.js,dist/globe-adinclude.js,dist/brightcove-asset-loader.js,dist/globe-subscription-banner.js,dist/globe-comments.js?v=17033I1505\"></script>\n</body>\n</html>\n", "title": "After the murder of his wife, a father carries on", "url": "http://www.bostonglobe.com/metro/2017/03/28/after-murder-his-wife-father-carries/IFSEFoLRxSosNnZoE1hWlJ/story.html?p1=BGMenu_Article", "date": "03-28-2017", "source": "bostonglobe", "text": "After the rape and murder of his wife, a father carries on\n\nRichard Nunez is up almost every morning at 4 to feed his 6-year-old son and change his diaper.\n\nThiago Nunez was born with severe disabilities that left him unable to walk on his own and functioning at the level of an infant. He relies almost entirely on his father, a 51-year-old former gym instructor who was left to care for Thiago and two other children after his wife was raped and murdered by a former neighbor in Mattapan in 2011.\n\n\u201cI\u2019m alone with Thiago and it is hard,\u201d Nunez said. \u201cI have three children to take care of and they\u2019re all destroyed emotionally.\u201d\n\nLast week, Nunez settled a lawsuit with the Dolben Company in Woburn, the firm that managed the complex on Fairlawn Avenue where Nunez\u2019s wife, Rosanna Mirielle Camilo, was killed. The confidential agreement was reached on the second day of jury deliberations following a two-week trial. The terms were not disclosed, but the family had asked the jury to award them over $22 million.\n\nAdvertisement\n\nA lawyer for Dolben, who argued in court that the company could not have prevented the killing, declined to comment on the settlement.\n\nWhatever financial reward the settlement produces, it cannot erase the years of hardship, past and future, that are the legacy of the violence of one afternoon six years ago. Crime victims often fall quickly from the public eye, left to deal alone with the emotional aftermath.\n\nThis was especially true of Richard Nunez.\n\nAdvertisement\n\nThe trial over the suit in Suffolk Superior Court earlier this month revealed the struggles the family has endured since the murder of Camilo, who was 34 when Eldrick Broom came into her basement apartment, raped her, then strangled her while Thiago lay in a crib in the next room. Camilo\u2019s daughter found her half-naked and bound body when she came home from school.\n\nA photograph of Richard Nunez's wife, Rosanna, adorned an end table in the living room of Nunez's apartment. John Tlumacki/Globe staff\n\nCamilo and Nunez had met in 1994 in their native Dominican Republic and already had two children when she became pregnant with Thiago in 2009. Doctors warned there could be complications. An energetic, affectionate woman with a deep Catholic faith, Camilo left behind a comfortable job arranging schedules for the country\u2019s president to have her baby in New Jersey, where she had family and access to better medical care.\n\nNunez stayed behind to care for the other children \u2014 a girl who is now 21, and a boy, who is now 16.\n\nThiago\u2019s condition was even worse than the couple had feared: He was born with a rare genetic abnormality so severe it kills most who have it.\n\nGet Fast Forward in your inbox: Forget yesterday's news. Get what you need today in this early-morning email. Enter email address: Sign Up Thank you for signing up! Sign up for more newsletters here\n\nCamilo moved to Boston to be near Children\u2019s Hospital, and her daughter, then 16, moved to the city to help.\n\nCamilo was placed in the Mattapan apartment in July 2011 by Action for Boston Community Development, a nonprofit that helps low-income families and families with special needs find housing.\n\nThe 347-unit complex, which is off Cummins Highway, had no surveillance cameras or guards despite a long history of problems, including the 2008 shooting of an infant being held by her father.\n\nBut Camilo could not afford to live anywhere else. Broom was among the more cordial residents, according to testimony at the trial. He lived across the hall with his pregnant girlfriend and had once helped Camilo carry groceries and Thiago\u2019s heavy stroller.\n\nAdvertisement\n\nCamilo had no idea that in August 2011 Broom had attacked his girlfriend, grabbing her by the throat and cursing at her in front of her children, according to arrest reports. But the girlfriend later recanted, saying Broom only pushed her. She did not want to press charges or kick Broom out of the home, and Dolben lawyers argued during the trial that managers could do little under those circumstances.\n\nClosing arguments took place in Suffolk Superior Court earlier this month in the case of the Camilo family vs. Fairlawn Avenue Apartments. John Tlumacki/Globe staff\n\nBut Albert Farrah, the family\u2019s lawyer, told jurors that managers had an obligation to keep him from the property and warn other residents about his arrest.\n\nInstead, Dolben managers moved him to another apartment in the complex.\n\nConvicted of killing Camilo in 2013, Broom was sentenced to life in prison.\n\nNunez, who had come to Massachusetts after the murder, eventually moved into a small apartment in Stoneham with Thiago and his two other children. Too overwhelmed by grief and the needs of his children to search for a job, Nunez relied on the local food pantry and second-hand stores for clothes. With the civil case behind him, Nunez said he is hopeful he can pay for his children\u2019s college education and Thiago\u2019s medical needs.\n\nThiago Nunez, 6, tried to kiss his father from inside a special netted bed where he got up from a short rest while his father was doing laundry. John Tlumacki/Globe staff\n\nThiago, who could live to be 40 to 45 years old, will need round the clock care for the rest of his life, according to his doctor, Ronald Samuels of Children\u2019s Hospital, who testified during the trial. \u201cI think it\u2019s very likely he will not develop much beyond the range of a toddler,\u201d Samuels said.\n\nThe family is now planning to leave Massachusetts for a fresh start and Nunez said he is anxious to start looking for work. The family is fiercely protective of Thiago, a joyful boy who craves affection. During the day he goes to the Campus School at Boston College for children with disabilities. Each day he is dropped off from school by a van, but before the driver even unbuckles him, Nunez rushes in to grab the boy and wrap him in a bear hug, singing his name. At his wife\u2019s funeral, Nunez swore he would always be there for Thiago.\n\n\u201cWhen I was putting my wife six feet down I made a promise to her,\u201d he said. \u201cShe was crazy about that boy.\u201d", "images": ["http://c.o0bg.com/rf/image_375x250/Boston/2011-2020/2017/03/26/BostonGlobe.com/Metro/Images/caitlyn.jpg", "http://www.bostonglobe.com/rf/image_585w/Boston/2011-2020/2017/03/29/BostonGlobe.com/Metro/Images/tlumacki_ThiagoNunez_metro005[1].jpg", "http://c.o0bg.com/rf/image_460w/Boston/2011-2020/2017/03/18/BostonGlobe.com/Metro/Images/tlumacki_ThiagoNunez_metro004.jpg", "http://www.bostonglobe.com/img/Device-LockUp-non-transparent.jpg", "http://c.o0bg.com/rf/image_460w/Boston/2011-2020/2017/03/18/BostonGlobe.com/Metro/Images/tlumacki_ThiagoNunez_metro018.jpg", "http://googleads.g.doubleclick.net/pagead/viewthroughconversion/1071256246/?value=0&guid=ON&script=0", "http://c.o0bg.com/rf/image_460w/Boston/2011-2020/2017/03/17/BostonGlobe.com/Metro/Images/tlumacki_camilotrial_metro030.jpg", "http://c.o0bg.com/rf/image_375x250/Boston/2011-2020/2017/02/14/BostonGlobe.com/Metro/Images/hayes_15farragher08_met.jpg", "http://c.o0bg.com/rf/image_835w/Boston/2011-2020/2017/03/29/BostonGlobe.com/Metro/Images/thiago-9026.jpg", "http://newyorktimes.112.2o7.net/b/ss/nytbostonglobecom/1/H.23.3--NS/0?pageName=News%20%7C%20BGC%20Homepage&ch=News&c1=News%20%7C%20BGC%20Homepage&c6=BGC%20Homepage&c41=BostonGlobe.com&v41=BostonGlobe.com", "http://c.o0bg.com/rf/image_375x250/Boston/2011-2020/2017/03/18/BostonGlobe.com/Metro/Images/tlumacki_ThiagoNunez_metro005.jpg", "https://www.facebook.com/tr?id=884869448226452&ev=PageView&noscript=1", "http://www.bostonglobe.com/rw/img/Device-LockUp-Mobile-non-transparent.jpg"], "videos": []}
